medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of palpitations and chest pressure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient felt well until 2 days earlier when he developed epigastric burning, fatigue, weakness, and emesis. The gastrointestinal symptoms partially improved with antacids. On presentation, his heart rate was 200 bpm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, benign prostatic hypertrophy with obstructive nephropathy, chronic renal insufficiency with dependence on dialysis until 1 year prior to presentation when he received a renal transplant. He has hyperparathyroidism and a history of bilateral cataract surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of lung cancer; mother had coronary-artery bypass surgery; one daughter and one sister have the GLA mutation.
medical_history.social_history: Remote history of alcohol use; never used tobacco or illicit drugs; worked as a janitor before receiving disability benefits; lives with his wife and two healthy children.
